intro: Psychotria acuminata var. latifolia, commonly known as the "Yareta" or "Coca plant," is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the Andean regions of South America, particularly Ecuador and Peru, where it thrives in high-altitude environments. The plant is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and small, white or pale green flowers. It is often found growing in rocky or alpine habitats, where it forms dense mats or cushions. Due to its habitat and appearance, it plays a significant ecological role in its native ecosystems.
